10813.a: A third child cannot be transported.
10813.b: A third child may be transported if he or she is at least 3 years old and restrained by a seat belt.
10813.c: A third child may be transported if he or she is at least 5 years old.

10814.q: Transporting a child restrained with seat belts in the back seat of a passenger car is:
10814.a: Allowed if the child is at least 135 cm tall and it is not possible to provide him with a safety seat due to his height and weight.
10814.c: Allowed if the child is at least 125 cm tall and it is not possible to provide him with a safety seat due to his height and weight.

10817.q: A police officer will confiscate a driving license issued in the country against receipt in the event of discovering an offense consisting in transporting people in a passenger car in a number exceeding the number of seats specified in the registration certificate with:

10818.q: Receipt of suspension of a driving license issued in the country due to the driver exceeding the speed limit by more than 50 km/h in a built-up area, entitles you to drive a vehicle during the period:
10818.a: 7 days from the date of arrest.
10818.b: 72 hours from the time of arrest.
10818.c: 24 hours from the time of arrest.

10820.q: If, despite the decision to suspend the driving license for 3 months, the person continued to drive a vehicle, the starosta extends the period for which the driving license was suspended until:

10824.a: Extension of the period of suspension of driving license by another 6 months.
10824.b: Extension of the period of suspension of driving license by another 3 months.

10825.q: A police officer will seize, against receipt, a driving license issued by a country other than the Republic of Poland, in the event of revealing an offense involving the transport of a passenger car:
10825.a: 1 person more than specified in the registration certificate.
10825.b: 3 more people than specified in the registration certificate.
10825.c: 2 more people than specified in the registration certificate.

10826.q: The driver of a vehicle registered in the territory of the Republic of Poland is obliged to carry and present for inspection the following document:
10826.a: Confirming the conclusion of compulsory third party liability insurance.
10826.b: Confirming that the vehicle is approved for traffic.
10826.c: Confirming the calibration of the alcohol interlock device, if the obligation to have an alcohol interlock device results from his driving license.

10827.b: A document confirming that the vehicle is admitted to traffic.
10827.c: A document confirming the conclusion of a compulsory third-party liability insurance contract for the vehicle owner.

10828.q: The obligation to carry a driving license issued in the territory of the Republic of Poland applies to:
10828.b: The driver of a passenger car.
10828.c: There is no such obligation, regardless of the type of vehicle we drive.

10833.b: It is the responsibility of the vehicle driver.

10834.q: The driver of a vehicle registered in the territory of the Republic of Poland is obliged to have with him and, at the request of an authorized body, present:
10834.a: A document confirming the right to drive a vehicle.
10834.b: A document confirming the right to drive a vehicle, other than a driving license issued in the country.
10834.c: A document confirming that the vehicle is admitted to traffic.

10835.q: The driver of a vehicle registered in the territory of the Republic of Poland and holding a driving license issued by the authorities of the Republic of Poland is obliged to have with him and to present at the request of the authorized authority:
10835.b: A document confirming the right to drive a vehicle.
10835.c: Proof of payment of the premium for compulsory civil liability insurance of the vehicle owner.

10836.q: The driver of a vehicle registered in the territory of the Republic of Poland, holding a driving license issued by the authorities of the Republic of Poland, is obliged to have with him and to present at the request of the authorized authority:
10836.a: Proof of payment of the premium for compulsory civil liability insurance of the vehicle owner.
10836.b: A document confirming the right to drive a vehicle.
10836.c: Other documents, if such an obligation results from a separate act.

10837.q: A vehicle registered in the territory of the Republic of Poland is removed from the road at the owner's expense in the event of:
10837.a: Leaving the vehicle in a place where it is prohibited and does not pose a threat to safety.
10837.b: Failure of the driver to present a document confirming the conclusion of a third party liability insurance contract.
10837.c: It is driven by a person who does not have a driving license and when it is not possible to secure the vehicle by handing it over to a person inside it who has the driving license.

10838.q: The driver of a passenger car registered abroad and involved in traffic in the territory of the Republic of Poland is obliged to have with him and present, at the request of an authorized authority:
10838.a: A document confirming the right to drive a vehicle other than a driving license issued in the country.
10838.b: Passport issued by the country where the vehicle was registered.
10838.c: Document confirming the completion of a technical inspection.

10839.a: A document confirming the right to drive a vehicle, issued in the territory of the Republic of Poland.
10839.b: A document confirming that the vehicle is admitted to traffic.
10839.c: Proof of payment of the compulsory third party liability insurance premium.

10841.a: A document confirming that the vehicle is admitted to traffic.
10841.b: A document confirming the right to drive a vehicle.
10841.c: Certificate of a technical inspection with a positive result in terms of equipping the vehicle with an alcohol interlock.

10842.q: Not having a driving license issued in the country while driving a passenger car on public roads in Poland:
10842.a: It does not result in any legal consequences.
10842.b: This results in the imposition of a fine.

10843.q: The driver of a vehicle registered in the territory of the Republic of Poland and holding authorizations issued by the authorities of the Republic of Poland is obliged to have with him and to present at the request of the authorized authority:
10843.b: A document confirming the calibration of the alcohol interlock device, if the obligation to have an alcohol interlock device results from your driving license.
10843.c: A document confirming the right to drive a vehicle.

10844.a: Determining the identity of the vehicle driver based on data from the Identity Card Register.
10844.b: Demand that the driver shows a driving license issued in the country.
10844.c: Requiring the driver to present a document confirming the conclusion of a third party liability insurance contract for a vehicle registered in the territory of the Republic of Poland.

13046.b: Such that other overtaking vehicles can safely enter the gap maintained between these vehicles.

2145.a: Call for help, then perform artificial breaths and chest compressions.
2145.b: Give artificial breaths and chest compressions for 1 minute, then call for help.
2145.c: Give artificial breaths and chest compressions for 15 minutes, then call for help.

2163.a: Pinch the wings of your nose and tilt your head forward.

2163.c: Pinch the wings of your nose and tilt your head back.

2177.c: Putting a pillow under the child's head.

2188.a: Encourage the injured person not to move.
2188.c: Try to position the limb above the heart.

2190.a: Bend the casualty's head to the chest.
2190.b: Put something soft under the injured person's head, e.g. a rolled up jacket.

2199.b: When cardiac arrest has occurred and the AED advises a shock.
2199.c: When the injured person has wet clothes or is lying in a puddle.
